channel.title: How to make "Mod" in ur name, u need to be mod?
channel.description:
Hello, How to make if people put "Mod" in their name, they get auto ban? And if mods have it not ban? :-)
thanks, I D D S I

item.title: How to make "Mod" in ur name, u need to be mod?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:33, topic:267862”]Sure.

if (playerName.contains("mod") && playerRights < 1) { writeLog(playerName, "bans"); disconnected = true; }[/quote]
Isn’t this the same as what I Nelson I gave you?

Read full topic
item.source: How to make "Mod" in ur name, u need to be mod?

item.dc:creator: @I_D_D_S_I I D D S I
item.description:
@I_D_D_S_I wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:45, topic:267862”]Bingo. You missed a right bracket though.
if (playerName.contains(“mod”) && !connectedFrom.equals(“127.0.0.1”))[/quote]
It doesnt work, every1 can create a account with “mod” :o
I realy need this

Read full topic

item.title: How to make "Mod" in ur name, u need to be mod?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Bingo. You missed a right bracket though.
if (playerName.contains(“mod”) && !connectedFrom.equals(“127.0.0.1”))
For multiple IPs:
if (playerName.contains(“mod”) && !(connectedFrom.equals(“IP”) || connectedFrom.equals(“IP2”)))

Read full topic

item.title: How to make "Mod" in ur name, u need to be mod?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Your code is “equalsIgnoreCase”. That doesn’t include names that contain Mod in it. You used this code?

if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("mod") && (playerRights >= 0)) { } else { writeLog(playerName, "bans"); disconnected = true; }

Read full topic

item.title: How to make "Mod" in ur name, u need to be mod?
item.dc:creator: @I_D_D_S_I I D D S I
item.description:
@I_D_D_S_I wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:31, topic:267862”]Lol, then use this -

if (playerName.contains("mod") && (connectedFrom != bas4-stcatharines10-1 279603727.dsl.bell.ca)) { writeLog(playerName, "bans"); disconnected = true; } if (playerName.contains("mod") && (connectedFrom != 94-192-252-170.zone6.bethere.co.uk)) { writeLog(playerName, "bans"); disconnected = true; } if (playerName.contains("mod") && (connectedFrom != 217-159-153-188-dsl.kt.estpak.ee)) { writeLog(playerName, "bans"); disconnected = true; }

I changed the “equalsIgnoreCase” to “contains”, because you want it so that if it contains “Mod”, they will be disconnected, not if their name is “Mod”.[/quote]
error : [code] client.java:8962: ‘)’ expected
if (playerName.contains(“mod”) && (connectedFrom != bas4-stcatharines10-1
^
client.java:8963: not a statement
279603727.dsl.bell.ca)) {
^
client.java:8963: ‘;’ expected
279603727.dsl.bell.ca)) {
^
client.java:8967: ‘)’ expected
if (playerName.contains(“mod”) && (connectedFrom != 94-192-252-170.zone6.bethere
.co.uk)) {
^
client.java:8967: illegal start of expression
if (playerName.contains(“mod”) && (connectedFrom != 94-192-252-170.zone6.bethere
.co.uk)) {
^
client.java:8967: ‘;’ expected
if (playerName.contains(“mod”) && (connectedFrom != 94-192-252-170.zone6.bethere
.co.uk)) {
^
client.java:8967: illegal start of expression
if (playerName.contains(“mod”) && (connectedFrom != 94-192-252-170.zone6.bethere
.co.uk)) {

^
client.java:8967: ‘;’ expected
if (playerName.contains(“mod”) && (connectedFrom != 94-192-252-170.zone6.bethere
.co.uk)) {

^
client.java:8967: not a statement
if (playerName.contains(“mod”) && (connectedFrom != 94-192-252-170.zone6.bethere
.co.uk)) {

^

client.java:8967: ‘;’ expected
if (playerName.contains(“mod”) && (connectedFrom != 94-192-252-170.zone6.bethere
.co.uk)) {

  ^

10 errors
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

can’t it be like this:

if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("mod") && (playerRights >= 0)) { } else { writeLog(playerName, "bans"); disconnected = true; }

Read full topic

item.title: How to make "Mod" in ur name, u need to be mod?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Lol, then use this -

if (playerName.contains("mod") && (connectedFrom != bas4-stcatharines10-1 279603727.dsl.bell.ca)) { writeLog(playerName, "bans"); disconnected = true; } if (playerName.contains("mod") && (connectedFrom != 94-192-252-170.zone6.bethere.co.uk)) { writeLog(playerName, "bans"); disconnected = true; } if (playerName.contains("mod") && (connectedFrom != 217-159-153-188-dsl.kt.estpak.ee)) { writeLog(playerName, "bans"); disconnected = true; }

I changed the “equalsIgnoreCase” to “contains”, because you want it so that if it contains “Mod”, they will be disconnected, not if their name is “Mod”.

Read full topic
